segment.source: Planning to Use Folder Redirection with App-V
segment.target: Planning to Use Folder Redirection with App-V

segment.source: Planning to Use Folder Redirection with App-V
segment.target: Planning to Use Folder Redirection with App-V

segment.source: Planning to Use Folder Redirection with App-V
segment.target: Planning to Use Folder Redirection with App-V

segment.source: App-V 5.0 SP2 supports the use of folder redirection, a feature that enables users and administrators to redirect the path of a folder to a new location.
segment.target: App-V 5.0 SP2 supports the use of folder redirection, a feature that enables users and administrators to redirect the path of a folder to a new location.

segment.source: This topic contains the following sections:
segment.target: This topic contains the following sections:

segment.source: Requirements for using folder redirection
segment.target: Requirements for using folder redirection

segment.source: How to configure folder redirection for use with App-V
segment.target: How to configure folder redirection for use with App-V

segment.source: How folder redirection works with App-V
segment.target: How folder redirection works with App-V

segment.source: Overview of folder redirection
segment.target: Overview of folder redirection

segment.source: Requirements and unsupported scenarios for using folder redirection
segment.target: Requirements and unsupported scenarios for using folder redirection

segment.source: Requirements
segment.target: Requirements

segment.source: To use %AppData% folder redirection, you must:
segment.target: To use %AppData% folder redirection, you must:

segment.source: Have an App-V package that has an AppData virtual file system (VFS) folder.
segment.target: Have an App-V package that has an AppData virtual file system (VFS) folder.

segment.source: Enable folder redirection and redirect users’ folders to a shared folder, typically a network folder.
segment.target: Enable folder redirection and redirect users’ folders to a shared folder, typically a network folder.

segment.source: Roam both or neither of the following:
segment.target: Roam both or neither of the following:

segment.source: Files under %appdata%\Microsoft\AppV\Client\Catalog
segment.target: Files under %appdata%\Microsoft\AppV\Client\Catalog

segment.source: Registry settings under HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\AppV\Client\Packages
segment.target: Registry settings under HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\AppV\Client\Packages

segment.source: For more detail, see Application Publishing and Client Interaction.
segment.target: For more detail, see Application Publishing and Client Interaction.

segment.source: Ensure that the following folders are available to each user who logs into the computer that is running the App-V 5.0 SP2 or later client:
segment.target: Ensure that the following folders are available to each user who logs into the computer that is running the App-V 5.0 SP2 or later client:

segment.source: %AppData% is configured to the desired network location (with or without Offline Files support).
segment.target: %AppData% is configured to the desired network location (with or without Offline Files support).

segment.source: %LocalAppData% is configured to the desired local folder.
segment.target: %LocalAppData% is configured to the desired local folder.

segment.source: Unsupported scenarios
segment.target: Unsupported scenarios

segment.source: Configuring %LocalAppData% as a network drive.
segment.target: Configuring %LocalAppData% as a network drive.

segment.source: Redirecting the Start menu to a single folder for multiple users.
segment.target: Redirecting the Start menu to a single folder for multiple users.

segment.source: If roaming AppData (%AppData%) is redirected to a network share that is not available, App-V applications will fail to launch as follows:
segment.target: If roaming AppData (%AppData%) is redirected to a network share that is not available, App-V applications will fail to launch as follows:

segment.source: App-V version
segment.target: App-V version

segment.source: Scenario description
segment.target: Scenario description

segment.source: In App-V 5.0 through App-V 5.0 SP2 plus hotfixes
segment.target: In App-V 5.0 through App-V 5.0 SP2 plus hotfixes

segment.source: This failure will occur regardless of whether Offline Files is enabled.
segment.target: This failure will occur regardless of whether Offline Files is enabled.

segment.source: In App-V 5.0 SP3
segment.target: In App-V 5.0 SP3

segment.source: If the unavailable network share has been enabled for Offline Files, the App-V application will start successfully.
segment.target: If the unavailable network share has been enabled for Offline Files, the App-V application will start successfully.

segment.source: How to configure folder redirection for use with App-V
segment.target: How to configure folder redirection for use with App-V

segment.source: Folder redirection can be applied to different folders, such as Desktop, My Documents, My Pictures, etc. However, the only folder that impacts the use of App-V applications is the user’s roaming AppData folder (%AppData%).
segment.target: Folder redirection can be applied to different folders, such as Desktop, My Documents, My Pictures, etc. However, the only folder that impacts the use of App-V applications is the user’s roaming AppData folder (%AppData%).

segment.source: You can apply folder redirection to any other supported folders without impacting App-V.
segment.target: You can apply folder redirection to any other supported folders without impacting App-V.

segment.source: How folder redirection works with App-V
segment.target: How folder redirection works with App-V

segment.source: The following table describes how folder redirection works when %AppData% is redirected to a network and when you have met the requirements listed earlier in this article.
segment.target: The following table describes how folder redirection works when %AppData% is redirected to a network and when you have met the requirements listed earlier in this article.

segment.source: Virtual environment state
segment.target: Virtual environment state

segment.source: Action that occurs
segment.target: Action that occurs

segment.source: When the virtual environment starts
segment.target: When the virtual environment starts

segment.source: The virtual file system (VFS) AppData folder is mapped to the local AppData folder (%LocalAppData%) instead of to the user’s roaming AppData folder (%AppData%).
segment.target: The virtual file system (VFS) AppData folder is mapped to the local AppData folder (%LocalAppData%) instead of to the user’s roaming AppData folder (%AppData%).

segment.source: LocalAppData contains a local cache of the user’s roaming AppData folder for the package in use.
segment.target: LocalAppData contains a local cache of the user’s roaming AppData folder for the package in use.

segment.source: The local cache is located under:
segment.target: The local cache is located under:

segment.source: The latest data from the user’s roaming AppData folder is copied to and replaces the data currently in the local cache.
segment.target: The latest data from the user’s roaming AppData folder is copied to and replaces the data currently in the local cache.

segment.source: While the virtual environment is running, data continues to be saved to the local cache.
segment.target: While the virtual environment is running, data continues to be saved to the local cache.

segment.source: Data is served only out of %LocalAppData% and is not moved or synchronized with %AppData% until the end user shuts down the computer.
segment.target: Data is served only out of %LocalAppData% and is not moved or synchronized with %AppData% until the end user shuts down the computer.

segment.source: Entries to the AppData folder are made using the user context, not the system context.
segment.target: Entries to the AppData folder are made using the user context, not the system context.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The App-V client folder redirection sometimes fails to move files from %AppData% to %LocalAppData%.
segment.target: The App-V client folder redirection sometimes fails to move files from %AppData% to %LocalAppData%.

segment.source: See Release Notes for App-V 5.0 SP2.
segment.target: See Release Notes for App-V 5.0 SP2.

segment.source: When the virtual environment shuts down
segment.target: When the virtual environment shuts down

segment.source: The local cached data in AppData (roaming) is zipped up and copied to the “real” roaming AppData folder in %AppData%.
segment.target: The local cached data in AppData (roaming) is zipped up and copied to the “real” roaming AppData folder in %AppData%.

segment.source: A time stamp, which indicates the last known upload, is simultaneously saved as a registry key under:
segment.target: A time stamp, which indicates the last known upload, is simultaneously saved as a registry key under:

segment.source: To provide redundancy, App-V 5.0 keeps the three most recent copies of the compressed data under %AppData%.
segment.target: To provide redundancy, App-V 5.0 keeps the three most recent copies of the compressed data under %AppData%.

segment.source: Overview of folder redirection
segment.target: Overview of folder redirection

segment.source: Purpose
segment.target: Purpose

segment.source: Enables end users to work with files, which have been redirected to another folder, as if the files still existed on the local drive.
segment.target: Enables end users to work with files, which have been redirected to another folder, as if the files still existed on the local drive.

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Folder redirection allows users and administrators to redirect the path of a folder to a network location.
segment.target: Folder redirection allows users and administrators to redirect the path of a folder to a network location.

segment.source: The documents in the folder are available to the user from any computer on the network.
segment.target: The documents in the folder are available to the user from any computer on the network.

segment.source: Folder redirection allows users and administrators to redirect the path of a folder to a network location.
segment.target: Folder redirection allows users and administrators to redirect the path of a folder to a network location.

segment.source: The documents in the folder are available to the user from any computer on the network.
segment.target: The documents in the folder are available to the user from any computer on the network.

segment.source: The new location can be a folder on the local computer or a folder on a shared network.
segment.target: The new location can be a folder on the local computer or a folder on a shared network.

segment.source: Folder redirection updates the files immediately, whereas roaming data is typically synchronized when the user logs in or logs off.
segment.target: Folder redirection updates the files immediately, whereas roaming data is typically synchronized when the user logs in or logs off.

segment.source: Usage example
segment.target: Usage example

segment.source: You can redirect the Documents folder, which is usually stored on the computer's local hard disk, to a network location.
segment.target: You can redirect the Documents folder, which is usually stored on the computer's local hard disk, to a network location.

segment.source: The user can access the documents in the folder from any computer on the network.
segment.target: The user can access the documents in the folder from any computer on the network.
